74416.text: Add --shutdown-delay-duration to kube-apiserver in order to delay a graceful shutdown. `/healthz` will keep returning success during this time and requests are normally served, but `/readyz` will return faillure immediately. This delay can be used to allow the SDN to update iptables on all nodes and stop sending traffic.
74416.markdown: Add --shutdown-delay-duration to kube-apiserver in order to delay a graceful shutdown. `/healthz` will keep returning success during this time and requests are normally served, but `/readyz` will return faillure immediately. This delay can be used to allow the SDN to update iptables on all nodes and stop sending traffic. ([#74416](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/74416), [@sttts](https://github.com/sttts)) Courtesy of SIG API Machinery
74416.author: sttts

60771.text: Fixes a bug where the kube-apiserver won't start if a broken webhook is installed and the client ca configmap is empty
60771.markdown: Fixes a bug where the kube-apiserver won't start if a broken webhook is installed and the client ca configmap is empty ([#60771](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/60771), [@jennybuckley](https://github.com/jennybuckley))
60771.author: jennybuckley

65782.text: Implementing deduplication logic for v1beta1.Event API
65782.markdown: Implementing deduplication logic for v1beta1.Event API ([#65782](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/65782), [@yastij](https://github.com/yastij))
65782.author: yastij

66635.text: The `system:aws-cloud-provider` cluster role, deprecated in v1.13, is no longer auto-created. Deployments using the AWS cloud provider should grant required permissions to the `aws-cloud-provider` service account in the `kube-system` namespace as part of deployment.
66635.markdown: The `system:aws-cloud-provider` cluster role, deprecated in v1.13, is no longer auto-created. Deployments using the AWS cloud provider should grant required permissions to the `aws-cloud-provider` service account in the `kube-system` namespace as part of deployment.  ([#66635](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/66635), [@wgliang](https://github.com/wgliang))
66635.author: wgliang

66928.text:
kubelet now allows use of XFS quotas (on XFS and suitably configured ext4fs filesystems) to monitor storage consumption for ephemeral storage (currently for emptydir volumes only).  This method of monitoring consumption is faster and more accurate than the old method of walking the filesystem tree.  It does not enforce limits, only monitors consumption.  To utilize this functionality, you must set the feature  gate `LocalStorageCapacityIsolationFSQuotaMonitoring=true`. For ext4fs filesystems, you must create the
filesystem with `mkfs.ext4 -O project <block_device>` and run `tune2fs -Q prjquota `block device`; XFS
filesystems need no additional preparation.  The filesystem must be mounted with option `project` in
`/etc/fstab`.  If your primary partition is the root filesystem, you must also add `rootflags=pquota` to your
GRUB config file.
66928.markdown:
kubelet now allows use of XFS quotas (on XFS and suitably configured ext4fs filesystems) to monitor storage consumption for ephemeral storage (currently for emptydir volumes only).  This method of monitoring consumption is faster and more accurate than the old method of walking the filesystem tree.  It does not enforce limits, only monitors consumption.  To utilize this functionality, you must set the feature  gate `LocalStorageCapacityIsolationFSQuotaMonitoring=true`. For ext4fs filesystems, you must create the
filesystem with `mkfs.ext4 -O project <block_device>` and run `tune2fs -Q prjquota `block device`; XFS
filesystems need no additional preparation.  The filesystem must be mounted with option `project` in
`/etc/fstab`.  If your primary partition is the root filesystem, you must also add `rootflags=pquota` to your
GRUB config file. ([#66928](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/66928), [@RobertKrawitz](https://github.com/RobertKrawitz)) Courtesy of SIG API Machinery, SIG Apps, SIG CLI, SIG Cloud Provider, SIG Cluster Lifecycle, SIG Node, SIG Release, SIG Scheduling, SIG Storage, and SIG Testing
66928.author: RobertKrawitz

71746.text: Expand kubectl wait to work with more types of selectors.

72832.text: The CustomPodDNS feature gate has graduated to GA, and can no longer be disabled. The feature gate will be removed in v1.16
72832.markdown: The CustomPodDNS feature gate has graduated to GA, and can no longer be disabled. The feature gate will be removed in v1.16 ([#72832](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/72832), [@MrHohn](https://github.com/MrHohn)) Courtesy of SIG Apps, SIG Network, and SIG Node
72832.author: MrHohn

73250.text: The `rules` field in RBAC Role and ClusterRole objects is now correctly reported as optional in the openapi schema.
